Description: Fragments of tapestry (paired warp threads); Part of a large roundel (a) and part of a curved band (b) in coloured wool with some bleached linen; Design similar on both - on a red ground, small stylised human figures - archers? - in yellow, green, and white, with dark blue outlines; Outer border of twisted yellow lines/scrolls enclosing rosettes on a dark blue ground; Inner border of diamond and almond-shaped "jewels" on a dark blue ground; (b) has a bi-coloured double cord sewn to it and some plain linen cloth; Warp: yellow wool, S spun, c.7 paired tpc; Weft: wool and linen S spun, c.32 tpc; Edges: ragged or cut; Sewing: in S spun, Z ply thread; Plain weave, linen cloth to which ornaments were sewn, warp: S spun, c.22 tpc; Weft: S spun, c.17 tpc
Curator's comments: Previous location cupboard 64, blue box; Probably tunic ornaments with (b) from the neck area; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (26.7.1990); Conservation photos show that (a) is not from a roundel but part of the same neck band that is (b) (18.11.2019)
Condition: Poor - very fragmentary; Unknown date stuck to sticky net
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
